html:
Lens maker TTArtisan has launched the RF 35mm f/1.4 Tilt Lens for RF APS-C cameras for only $169. Tilt lenses are a lot of fun, and are definitely worth trying out for under $200. Tilt lenses are manual focus by nature.

The TTArtisan RF 35mm f/1.4 Tilt will work on the EOS R100, EOS R50, EOS R10 and EOS R7 and the brand new EOS R50 V. It will also work in “crop mode” on full-frame RF mount cameras.

The TTArtisan RF 35mm f/1.4 Tilt is now available for purchase at Amazon for $169 USD.

TTArtisan 35mm F1.4 Tilt

5

  • For APS-C
  • Tilt and 360° Rotation function
  • Unique Dual-Bokeh Design (Bubble / Soft)
  • F1.4 Large Aperture
  • 0.35m Minimum Focusing Distance
  • Full Metal Body

What is a Tilt Lens?

Focus Area not Parallel to CMOS: With the tilt function of a tilt lens, even at the same aperture, you can achieve sharp focus on diagonally positioned or receding subjects, delivering greater control over the plane of focus.

Focus Area Parallel to CMOS: Without tilt, this lens performs like a standard 35mm F1.4 lens. At large apertures, only subjects on the focal plane stay sharp, while the rest melt into creamy bokeh.

F1.4 Large Aperture: The F1.4 aperture creates beautiful bokeh, effortlessly capturing the ambiance of night scenes and shallow depth of field.

Control The Focus: With a tilt lens, you can keep one eye in sharp focus while letting the other blur, creating a unique and artistic portrait style.

Summary

One of China’s big photography trade shows runs this week, so we expect to see a lot of announcements from the Chinese Lens Makers, and hopefully we do get some affordable unique lenses as well as new AF lenses for the RF mount, even if just for APS-C.
